## Explore (30 minutes)

In groups of 3-4

- Read the original paper

- Read the critique and the editorial

- Download the data + code and take a look -- is the code readable?
  - You may have to unzip the zip file of country-level CSVs and set the working directory
  
  - In 2013, `plyr` was the equivalent of `dplyr` (`ddply` $\approx$ `group_by` + `summarize`)    
  [When you're done with this exercise, clear your session!! Loading dplyr and then plyr will give you lots of weird errors.]{.emph .red}
  

## Discuss (30 minutes)

- What choices did Reinhardt & Rogoff make in their analysis that were later critiqued?

- Which choices were simple mistakes?

- Which choices were statistically justifiable?

- Which choices were statistical misconduct?

- What could have been done differently?

# Cambridge Analytica and Facebook

{{< video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q91nvbJSmS4 >}}


## Digging In

- [Analysis of Ethics of Facebook Data Handling](https://repositories.lib.utexas.edu/server/api/core/bitstreams/25af2643-9128-49d2-863e-cb5ff3aee9ce/content)

- [Guardian - Cambridge Analytica and Facebook Influenced US Elections](https://web.archive.org/web/20250407142019/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2018/mar/17/cambridge-analytica-facebook-influence-us-election)

- [Guardian - Whistleblower profile of Christopher Wylie](https://web.archive.org/web/20250407142129/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2018/mar/17/data-war-whistleblower-christopher-wylie-faceook-nix-bannon-trump)

- [Downstream Effects of the Cambridge Analytica Scandal (Bipartisan Policy Center)](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/blog/cambridge-analytica-controversy/)

- [The Guardian's full investigation](https://www.theguardian.com/news/series/cambridge-analytica-files)

## Explore (30 minutes)

In groups of 3-4

- Read the Guardian articles and associated content

- Gauge the magnitude of the problem and list out the ethical lapses you notice when reading



## Discuss (30 minutes)

- What choices did Facebook make that were 
  - reasonable mistakes?
  - ethically problematic? 
  - defensible?

- What choices did Cambridge Analytica make that were 
  - reasonable mistakes?
  - ethically problematic? 
  - defensible?

- What impact do you think the ethical breaches had on the world?
